activities.name: City Palace
activities.description: Visit the City Palace, a beautiful complex showcasing a blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture. Explore the museums within the palace.
activities.notes: Best to visit early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid the midday heat. Indoor sections offer respite from the heat.

activities.name: Hawa Mahal
activities.description: See the iconic Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds). Take photos from outside or explore the museum inside.
activities.notes: Primarily an external viewing attraction, but the museum inside is small and provides a cooler environment.

activities.name: Shopping at Bapu Bazaar
activities.description: Explore Bapu Bazaar for traditional Rajasthani textiles, handicrafts, and jewelry. Bargaining is expected.
activities.notes: Look for shaded areas and shops with air conditioning to escape the heat. Carry water.

activities.name: Dinner at Chokhi Dhani (Optional)
activities.description: Experience Rajasthani culture and cuisine at Chokhi Dhani, an ethnic village resort.
activities.notes: Mostly an open-air experience, so consider the heat. Evening visits are preferable.

food.name: Laxmi Misthan Bhandar (LMB)
food.description: Enjoy traditional Rajasthani sweets and snacks.

activities.name: Amer Fort
activities.description: Visit Amer Fort, a magnificent fort located on a hill. Opt for a jeep ride or walk up. Explore the palace complex, including the Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace).
activities.estimated_cost: Rs. 550 per person (entry fee), Rs. 1100 (jeep ride, optional)
activities.notes: Visit early in the morning to avoid the scorching sun. There are indoor sections within the fort that offer some relief.

activities.name: Jaigarh Fort
activities.description: Visit Jaigarh Fort, overlooking Amer Fort. See the world's largest cannon on wheels and enjoy panoramic views.
activities.notes: Can be extremely hot during the day, plan to visit early morning/late afternoon.

activities.name: Albert Hall Museum
activities.description: Visit Albert Hall Museum, the oldest museum in Rajasthan, showcasing a collection of artifacts and artworks.
activities.notes: Offers an excellent indoor escape from the heat, with air-conditioned spaces.

activities.name: Galtaji Temple (Monkey Temple)
activities.description: Visit the Galtaji Temple, known for its natural springs and temples. Be cautious of monkeys.
activities.notes: Best visited early morning or late afternoon. Mostly outdoors, but some shaded areas are available. Be aware of monkeys.

food.name: Tapri Central
food.description: Enjoy tea, snacks, and light meals with a modern twist.

food.name: Indian Coffee House
food.description: A classic spot for coffee and Indian snacks.

recommendations.name: Zostel Jaipur
recommendations.notes: Good for budget travelers, social atmosphere.

recommendations.name: Umaid Bhawan - A Heritage Style Boutique Hotel
recommendations.notes: offers a luxurious stay in heritage style. Good service and centrally located.

weather_notes: Jaipur in May is extremely hot. It is recommended to limit outdoor activities during the day and stay hydrated. Seek shelter in air-conditioned or shaded areas whenever possible. Travel during the cooler hours of the day, early morning or late afternoon. Consider packing light cotton clothes, sunglasses, sunscreen and a hat.
transportation: Use ride-sharing apps like Uber or Ola for convenient transport, or hire a local taxi/auto-rickshaw for shorter distances. Negotiate the fare beforehand.
